I'm a big fan of Bourbon and Branch and think they have some of the better crafted cocktails I've tried and that Wilson&Wilson is probably one of the best cocktail bars hands down. At Devil's Acre, I tried the Clover's Leap, Three Sworn Enemies, Pisco Punch, Bourbon Crusta and the Manhattan and the one thing they all had in common was an abundance of sweetness. I ended up ordering whiskey for the rest of the night.

Maybe it was just the particular evening and I still enjoyed drinking there with friends but I find BB and WW's cocktails much more enjoyable.
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
Swanky bar, slightly confused space.

Top notch service. Ask and ye shall receive! ...the rundown on sprits, bitters, your beverage selection, you name it. Table service (and reservations) if that's your thing. A few small tables and standing room if it's not.

Menu options to keep you coming back with a wide variety of spirits, tinctures, old fashioned sodas (non-alcoholic), hangover cures, and a sprinkling of gold dust. Gold dust for the gold rush (cocktails)?  Perhaps. Either way, a nice touch, never tacky.

Bar area is well thought out and designed. Main area has a wall of old-timey decor, think old pharmacy canisters lining the shelves, brass accents and blue-grays throughout, but it doesn't feel warm or have much going on. It just feels like a big room with lots of tables. A ramp leading into the bar area with a couple stairs down to the main seating (reservations area). Why it couldn't all by level? Who knows.

Tiny tables in the bar area might be your best bet for having a little one-on-one, but good luck snagging one once people realize this is the new 'it' spot on Columbus.

In the meantime, I'll keep coming back. And keep an eye out for the bar down below... because one bar is never enough when it's this good.
author: Alissa A.

description:
I love this new addition to the North Beach neighborhood, went this weekend for late night drinks with a friend.  The place is dark and classy, a little loud, but you can still hear the playlist - other patrons even started singing along when Tiny Dancer came on.  

The menu was so cool!  Its a rather wide book (compared to a typical one-pager), and even had ads for other bars in the area.  My friend and I enjoyed reading the horoscopes in the menu as well.  

The drinks came out and were very tasty, but again, I was most impressed with the finishing touches.  I had a cocktail up, and my friend had one with pebble ice - only she got a coaster.  Also, there was a pearl at the end of the toothpick holding fruit in her glass!

We only stayed for one drink, but this is certainly one place I will come back to - maybe when Tosca is too crowded?
author: Beth V.

description:
Heard about this bar through fellow yelper/bartender Brian H. and had to take the soonest opportunity to visit. Came here last friday around 11. No line or wait, but once we got inside, we saw it was PACKED. Luckily, I had a clear path to the bar and was quickly addressed by the lady bartender (sorry, I don't remember your name!). Me being me, I chose the drink that had bourbon and GOLD DUST-- "Three Sworn Enemies". I was kinda disappointed when I got the drink and I didn't see any gold dust.. but second time around from the downstairs bar, there was plenty of gold shimmering in my glass :) I got another drink that night too but can't recall.... I just know everything I sipped on that night was tasty, not watered-down, and cheap!

Anyway, the upstairs is good for groups (big groups--make a reservation) because it's more lively and loud. However, if you sneak down the stairs to the side of the bar, you'll find a much quieter chill vibe. Better for one-on-one time, they were playing some old school music that night. There's a small bar, a few small tables (open seating) and maybe 10? stools along the walls.

P.S. I was told I totally messed up by not trying any of their sodas. So you should definitely try one.

P.P.S. Irrelevant, but I love the black and gold wallpaper downstairs
author: Annie N.

description:
Their cocktails are perfection. This is how mixology is meant to be. I asked the waitress for a recommendation and what I ended up getting was exactly how she described it and also what I was looking for. Somehow, they magically mix the drink to be potent enough that you can feel a slight buzz from your drink...but it's mixed so well that you don't taste the alcohol!  
Some of the best drinks I've ever had!  Do yourself a favor and try this place.
author: Sarah A.

description: I love bars that have a throw back feel and The Devil's Acre does it right.  We stopped by here before a dinner with friends as we had seen it from the street but had never been inside.  We just ordered one drink but it was really tasty and a great environment.  It took a little while for the drink to be made as there was only one bartender.  I got the Golden Era and it was really tasty.
author: Blake B.

description:
Excellent cocktails - among the best in SF that I've had.

Unfortunately this place is always SO noisy. Be prepared to be at a table with 3 other friends and barely able to hear each other. Of course this place is popular so noise is unavoidable - but it seems noisier than the average busy bar.

What a shame since the drinks are always so tasty.
author: Aditi J.

description:
came here with a girlfriend last night and had a blast over their delicious cocktails!  the devil's acre almanac (menu) is really fun to read and flip through, and has advertisements from local businesses such as cask, comstock, etc.  and the binding and printing is very fun, and fits the theme so well.

we tried 3 of their own cocktails, and then my friend ordered a french 75 off the menu. they were all so refreshing and delicious!  my fave was the pisco punch was so pretty, and had a candied pineapple on top. YUM! 

drinks are about 10-11 each, which is reasonable for SF well-made cocktails, so definitely be back to try more of them very soon! they also have elixir and aromatics at $2 a pop, that you can add to your cocktails for your 'ailments' which was pretty interesting, but not really my thing.. the service was super awesome - the lady who helped us was clearly knowledgeable about the entire menu as well as combinations of flavors, which was good because my friend couldnt articulate really well what she wanted to drink... A+!
author: Christina L.

description: Excellent drinks!  This was a return visit for us and we love the menu and the decor in the bar and the location.  Both times we wish the bartender was a little more interactive we may have stayed for more than one drink!  But top notch drinks and mixing the drinks!
author: Jen H.

description:
Impressed with the selection and service is good. They know their drinks.

Enjoy

I highly recommend. Great price on Angel's Envy
author: Louie S.

description: Love this place!! We came early and found seating with ease. Fun unique drinks with an old time menu. Cute concept and place. Great place to start the night with a cocktail!
author: Karen R.

description: Really cool old-timey bar, concept is like, 1920s Rx tonics / sodas / cocktails and they also have a ton of liquor. I wish I could've tried the cream soda but I went for a cocktail instead, the pisco. My friend and I also tried the immunity tonic, and it was super licorice-y and intense, not the best tasting but it was a cool experience, definitely worth a few dollars. We went on a weeknight around 9pm and it wasn't super busy or loud, so it's good for casually catching up with friends. They also have a guy playing jazzy piano tunes. I'm a fan!
author: Christine Y.

description: A classy place with a long menu of drinks.  The vibe, ambiance, and drinks were fantastic. It's a good place to go before dinner for cocktails.
author: Michael V.

description: This is s fun place for a cocktail if you don't have night expectations of great service.  Truth is.... service is mixed... some really care... some are going through the motions.     The space is gorgeous.  The drinks are good.    Come for one.   We were one and done.
author: Paul B.

description: Started the night off with this place.  Cute, quaint, dark, mysterious (since they have a secret bar/place downstairs!)  Unfortunately there was a private event going on and we couldn't explore.  The place is nice, but a little bit loud.  We were just yelling at each other.  It wasn't packed, but enough people that it's a nice and happening place.  I'm an interior designer, so I will most likely comment on the atmosphere, decor, ambiance.  This place did a great job at it and I would love to come back and experience it another time.  Although, for a spacious place like this I would assume they serve food.....or they should serve food.  It would make it that much better for me, IMO.  But perhaps, they have no kitchen, blah blah blah.  Definitely come check it out if you're in the area.  It's like in the middle of all cray cray happenings.
author: Lisa V.

description: Going into the night, I had no idea what to expect. When we first arrived I feel like we stepped into a movie scene featuring the prohibition. So many antiques and a very authentic yet trendy vibe. The lighting was ambient and it encouraged mysterious and playful conversation. The basement bar was cute and lowkey- however it did shut down earlier then the main lounge/bar. I will definitely come back. Drinks were small but quality.
author: Lydia B.

description:
Loved the atmosphere in here. Had that wild west saloon feel, which was cool and unique to us. The menu was particularly awesome so if you're looking for a cool, semi-elegant experience you should definitely check this place out.

They have a ride selection of items on their menu but we ended up straying away from the menu and getting a Vesper, which I was glad to hear they could make and they made all of the rounds quite well.
author: Neechi M.

description:
I've been here a couple times before and thought it was a great but this most recent time was simply disappointing.

My friend and I ordered two Devil's Manhattans.  There was so much bitters or vermouth and sweetener that we hardly tasted the bourbon.  The after taste reminded me of what you'd get after drinking a cup of prune juice.  A Manhattan isn't supposed to be super sweet and prune-y. Just sayin'

We called the waitress over and asked her if we could get a different drink or add bourbon to it.  She went and talked to the bartender who told her that if we got a different drink we have to pay for these bad ones anyway.

In my years of drinking/eating, I have never been to a place that would refuse to modify or replace an unsatisfactory drink and CHARGE us for it too!

By the way, the reason I decided to host a happy hour get together here was because they supposedly had Angel's Envy (BEST DRINK EVER) on their online menu.  But when I got there, they did not have it - it wasn't even listed on their menu. 

I was DOUBLY DISAPPOINTED. I ain't goin' back.
author: TM O.

description: When we were walking around north beach looking for a bar that wasn't already bustling with people, we stumbled upon The Devil's Acre. The sweet host told us that there was seating downstairs too; curiously we walked down to find a small cozy little space that could fit 20-25 people at max. They had a separate bar downstairs (very sweet bartender, I wish I remembered her name), no table service though. We sat there for an hour or so after which we were moved upstairs as they were closing the basement for a private event. Our waitress upstairs was a little ignorant and took forever to take our order. But when she did, she was helpful in getting me a drink that I needed customized. Over a time span of 2-2.5 hours we tried the Bourbon Crusta, St. Croix Fix, the Dealers Choice (customized ) and Cruzan rum with Coke. All drinks were delish, not to forget that their menu is very innovative! I would go back to try the other options on their menu :)
author: Reema B.

description:
Do yourself a favor and do not come to this establishment. Not worth your time or money. 

Came here on a Sunday night after a long conference ....had dinner and figured my colleague and I needed a night cap... Came to the bar around 11.  It was under the impression that if you order a drink during last call you would have time to drink it. Drink came out 15-20 minutes later, bartender said we could drink it ... But even before we got our drink, the door "officer" told us we had to leave... Told him we ordered the drink but still didn't get it... Got our drink, which were about 11-12 a pop and basically was told the place was closed ... The bouncer came to us twice and told us we had to leave. When we told him he said it was closed at 12, he came up with "everyone has to be out by 1145." A contradiction of what he said earlier...

With that he watched us from less than three feet Away finish our drink. Felt like trump trying to intimate Hillary during the debates.  Bartenders didn't even say anything or do anything. Thank guys! 

If you want to chug cocktails like a college student , come here ! If you want to go to a place where you're  treated like a grown respectable, adult, don't come here. 

Thanks folks for a horrible experience.  Just remember what comes around goes around.
author: J L.

description: One of my favorites. The drink menu is filled with many great, strong cocktails but the best drinks I've found are made at the bar when you specifically ask for a certain taste.  Perfect spot for drinks with a group and very cool ambiance but make sure you have a reservation. I've been scolded several times for showing up without a reservation even when there were maybe two parties in total in the bar.
author: Rachel T.

description:
I'll give it a solid Meehhhhh. Went for happy hour on a Friday afternoon around 5. There were maybe 4 other tables and a couple of peeps at the bar in a rather large restaurant BUT after waiting 15 minutes for a menu, we asked the hostess if we should order at the bar and she replied that's there's a server, just be patient.

OhhhK so after we get a menu 20 minutes or so after sitting down we finally order. Maybe things are on the up and up?

Not so fast-we watch every table around us receive their order and still we wait. A quick trip to the bar reveals that our drinks are finally in progress.

Finally, 40 minutes in, were sippin that sweet, sweet booze.

Cocktails are solid for sure but be prepared for sub-par service even at a slow time.
author: Mimia J.

description: Really great ambience! We went around 11 and stayed till 1. Pretty empty around 1. Drinks were delicious and service was good too.
author: Nitesh D.

description:
A nice addition to the North Beach neighborhood! It's hard to compete with Comstock and 15 Romolo, but I think The Devil's Acre is solidly in the running. If you've been to Local Edition, this is a lighter, cozier version. 

We walked in on a Friday evening and although the tables all had reserved signs, when we asked the hostess seated us at one right away. I love a bar where you can sit, plop your bag down, and order from a server rather than aggressively bumping elbows at the bar! Much more relaxing after a hectic week at work.

I ordered the signature cocktail with rum and pineapple juice and it was just right. 

Note that there's a smaller bar area downstairs, although the vibe isn't quite as nice.
author: Lindsey B.

description:
Fun drinks + great atmosphere! 

Perfect for a date night or a meet up with a few friends during the work week. It gets pretty wild on Friday and Saturday nights.
author: Chinae G.

description: Loved the Pimms Punch and the St Croix fix, which are both pretty sweet drinks. We came here on a Saturday night and had a great time. They have cool mixes of non alcoholic drinks like cream soda, to which you can also add alcohol too if you want. Service was good and it was the perfect place for us to catch up with our friends.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
The latest from Future Bars Ltd. Unlike it's other offerings, there doesn't seem to be cohesive theme here.  It almost feels like you are walking into an Soda Bar or Ice Cream bar from America's yesteryears.  Or you kind of expect to see an old school pharmacist serving up Dr. Pepper.  The Vinyl aprons seem to perpetuate this idea, but almost with a butcher shop feel.  There is also a downstairs, which doesn't match the mood upstairs, more a dungeon/cellar feel.  

That being said the drinks are awesome!  The Manhattan was exceptional, right up there with Rickhouse's Old Fashioned.  The attention to detail in the presentation also deserves recognition, each drinking coming with a pearl looking tipped toothpick.  

Bartenders were also very professional as you would expect from any of the Future Bars.  I don't think it it tops Local Edition or Rickhouse as places to hangout, but the drinks are definitely in the top tier.
author: Veasna H.

description:
Best bar in town.  Live music, classy speak easy feeling , amazing drinks, and sexy bar tenders who know how to have good conversation while busy- al this in addition to the fact of course that it is in North Beach, best part of town.  
I absolutely adore this place.
author: Genevieve M.

description: Jack is the best bartender!!! We felt so welcome and this bad has AMAZING drinks and great happy hours
author: Leena J.

description: Jack was the absolute worst bartender ever. I'm kidding, he was amazing...and from New Jersey. Great bar, great drinks. Thanks, Jack! :)
author: Jillian D.

description: I've been to a lot of of places like this, but the ambiance, staff and drinks combined were fantastic. I am a fan...Now, if this place was only closer to me and NOT 2 feet from Chinatown.
author: Tony B.

description:
If you love to try new things, these throwback cocktails are just what the doctor ordered. 
Even a decent place to bring friends that can't have sugar/alcohol, as the offer their herbal concoctions with seltzer and no additional alcohol/sugar (minus the vodka used to make the tincture).
author: Alex-yelp Y.

description:
This is an outstanding cocktail bar on columbus.
Like most of the city, there's limited street parking close by so your best bet is to ditch the car and uber/bike/walk/public transport or otherwise use any method that does not involve trying to park downtown.
The bar itself-the one you'll be sitting at- is a restored turn of the century piece with footrest, hard wood inlay item with those little hooks underneath for you to forget your bag or coat on. That's new leather you'll be resting your arm on as well. Nice touch. If you come with a group the plethora of tables with comfy chairs may be a better choice as they allow for cozier conversation then packed in at the bar. There's a hostess to help with any seating needs and waitstaff work the tables, but be warned on busy nights the table service may be a little slower. 
The staff at the bar are red hot experts at mixology.
The house take on an old fashioned is perfect. The bartender serving us tested the non alcoholic seven up equivalent (for the teetotaler in our party.) and was unsatisfied with the quality. Remade it on the spot prior to serving it. Nicely done.
Note that this is a cocktail bar, and while there's nothing wrong with a beer and a shot or a glass of wine, that's not really the strong suite here. If that's your game you'd be better off somewhere else.
They also have herbal concoctions that may have some health benefits, offered with or without adding them to an alcoholic beverage. I would suspect that adding an herbal health blend to a manhattan would reduce the benefits somewhat, but that's an experiment for another night.
Not an economical choice as you are looking at at least ten dollars a drink, but the quality, ambiance and service is unbeatable.
author: Steven W.

description: Cool bar in a great location. The bartender was extremely knowledgeable and more importantly really tried to tailor the drink to the patron's palate.
author: Michael Y.

description: Great speak easy in the Broadway/Little Italy neighborhood. Dark rustic ambiance and crafty cocktails with various bitters. Lots of seating.
author: Sheryl A.

description: Reminds me of a speakeasy, but it isn't one! You get the specialty cocktails, without having to whisper. The bartender knows his drinks. I love that I can tell him the flavors I'm looking for and ta-da, it's made. The downstairs is just an awesome space.
author: Marlene T.

description: I've spent about 30 minutes at Devil's Acre over the span of two visits - once when it was about 50% full, and another time when it was pretty slow. The second time, I actually sat at the empty-ish bar and tried to make eye contact with the bartender, who was apparently more interested in checking his phone and chatting with his colleague than making drinks.  Exactly zero people offered to take my drink order during these two visits. Their drinks could be terrific, or they could be awful, but I guess I'll never know on account of their poor service.
author: Connie S.

description: What a great spot for cocktails! Plus, they're right next to my favorite bars like Vesuvio and Tosca. The wait time for cocktails are typical, but the space is lovely.
author: Lisa R.

description: I loved the atmosphere of this place and the drink selection. I got the love potion (no alcohol) and it had an interesting taste. Unfortunately I didn't find love or get lucky that night but it was fun. I had a great time hanging with my friends and the vibe was really kool and the music and atmosphere was rad.
author: Heather S.

description:
Just last weekend I threw my birthday party in the Devil Acre's downstairs rentable area, The Remedie Room, and could not be happier with how it went. From my initial reach out, to booking, and ultimately the party itself, I was impressed with how easy communication and planning was. The night of the party, we were able to arrive a few minutes early to set up and were greeted by our extremely friendly bartender for the night, Jay, and our "bouncer," Chris. Both were awesome dudes who treated us like old friends and boy did we have a grand ole time. The Remedie Room itself was AWESOME. And the perfect place to throw an oldtime themed party or something of that vein. Although they only allow you to have 30 guests at a time, the space was actually quite large, with ample seating area for everyone and tons of tables to put out food and decorations. I brought a TON of decorations and things to hang on the walls and the staff was super into it as long as I didn't hang anything on their fancy wallpaper. But even if you don't have the time or care for extra decorations, the room itself is awesome as is and just about everyone commented how cool they thought the room was.

Drinks were AWESOME. I'm not a huge drinker and so was super surprised by how delicious I found everything I tried! Even the more seasoned drinkers of our group were super impressed with how well the drinks were made.

While at the end I was unfortunately left with covering a large unmet bar minimum, the delicious drinks, the very cool decor of the room and our awesome bartender totally made the large spend worth it for the special experience that it was. Some day when I have more money, I'll be back!
author: Rachel L.

description: What I get from this bar right away is that's it's a cozy bar with a feel of an old fashion kind of taste. I like the fact that you can relax at the bar order your drink and read a little book of information about drinks to order as well as random info as well.
author: Hicham J.

description: Bartender was amazing with his concoction... Told him what base I wanted, and then let him do his thing. The actual aesthetics of the place is very neat, with a bootlegger feel to it. Perfect for a fun first date!
author: Molly S.

description:
Good drinks, prices fairly cheap unless you're ordering some silly concoction. Really, if you need all that sugar to water down the booze, you ought to stick to kool aid. Nonetheless, service is crap--which is unfortunately the case for a lot of places in the city of this type. Lots of beards, tight pants, and questionable beverage choices--if that's your thing. Plenty of other places to drink in this neighborhood, no need to waste time/money here. 

* Your trust is our top concern, so businesses can't pay to alter or remove their reviews
author: Charles F.

description: Gold im ma drank.. omg that was the dopest
author: Richard H.

description: Awesome drinks.  Very knowledgeable bartenders that suggested a drink I normally wouldn't order, (something with Brandy) and I was very happy I did cuz it was bomb.  Everything's measured out to perfection = consistently good. Only negative was its loud & echoey, front door opens up a few steps from the bar so a bit chilly. I'll be back though :)
author: Holly S.

description: I made a reservation here for my graduation celebration. The service was friendly, the drinks were good and the interior was fantastic.
author: Lauren M.

description: Tempted to give a one star, but my girlfriend liked her drink. Typical rude San Francisco bartenders. I ordered my drink five minutes before happy hour ended (pointing at happy hour menu as I ordered) but they took their time to make my drink until after happy hour passed, charged full price, and gave me a hard time when I brought it up. Very frustrating experience.
author: Charles F.

description:
Pretty good cocktails - really liked Clover Leaf. Had a table ready for us even though we were 45 min early (we were just going to drink at the bar until our reservation time) so that was a pleasant surprise. The decor was retro in a cute way and the wall of old-time elixirs was pretty interesting. 

FYI two of my friends didn't know we had a waitress and ordered drinks at the bar and said it took forever so beware. We had a pretty good experience at the table, though, so try to grab one early!
author: Julie K.

description: I can't believe I've walked by this place so many times without going in! It looks like any old-fashion saloon or former brothel inside. Even the cash registers behind the bar look a century older than me. I had the 3 sworn enemies; it was great, had cool gold dust in it that shimmers when you move the glass around. We loved the giant square ice cubes too. We only stopped in for a quick drink before dinner, but I was definitely impressed. Not to mention we ordered four different custom drinks and our bartender did make them rather quickly. It's a bit on the pricey side, but we all enjoyed our drinks and I look forward to the next visit.
author: Jesse G.

description:
Depending on the night it could take a while to get your drink. But oh so worth it!

I've loved this place since it opened. You've got to appreciate the art that is the space, menu, and cocktails themselves. 

Go find someone you really like and get drunk on herbal infused whatevers by candlelight!
author: Ainslee S.

description: A great place to go to and hang out with friends. Our waitress was energetic and knowledgeable about the menu, definitely made our experience more enjoyable and added value. The musician was also a lot of fun to listen to as we caught up on life. Very much enjoyed both beverages with egg white. I understand why they seem to be low on menus, a lot of fun to read through.
author: Spencer M.

description: We rented the downstairs Remedie Room at Devil's Acre for a birthday party recently and it could not have been a better experience. Booking was easily & both the rental & bar minimum were quite reasonable for the size of our group (~30). Everyone was extremely friendly & helpful, & Kelly made fantastic drinks for us all night. There is no food but they were happy to let us bring in Tommaso's pizza (as long as we supplied plates, etc.) for no extra charge. Things could not have worked out better and I would recommend the space (and the tasty drinks!) to anyone for a private event.
author: Angela B.

description: Bar tenders were friendly as we sat at classy yet comfortable bar. Drinks met expectations. Was a nice space that I would like to revisit.
author: J K.

description: Man how do you go wrong with great attentive staff making top notch cocktails and keeping a sense of humor with the customers. Great vibe, great drinks, and great meatball.
author: Rob D.

description: The ambience is very casual with lots of open tables reminiscent of a speakeasy. I don't exactly remember the name of the drink I ordered but it was "citrus" something.. My first thought was that it was pretty sweet for my taste. I wished the drinks were a bit stronger especially for it's price tag.
author: Rosanna T.

description: Gorgeous bar with a great ambiance. Beautifully crafted cocktails! Busy and loud but fast service.
author: Anne L.

description: My roommate showed me this bar my first week of living in the city. Now almost 2 years later, this is still my go to recommedation for anyone hanging out in the city. Love this place!
author: Inna S.

description: This place is ok. There were quite a few liqueurs I've never heard of. Service was good and the bartenders will actually give you exact walking time to other local bars, which I thought was cool. The drink I got here was the Prospector. It was a little strong for me. I also had a sip of my bf's drink, and it was equally strong. I think if you prefer strong drinks like old fashions and bourbon drinks, this is the place for you. I tend to like the more citrus flavored drinks, and there wasn't many on the menu that night. I'm sure they could have made me something just as good off the menu though. Not sure if their menu changes often, but will probably come back.
author: Lisa T.

description:
a nice, open cocktail bar for a drink before italian dinner up the road. we walked in a snagged a table easily and loved perusing the menu. they have so many cocktail options to choose from, i went with a heavy bourbon options and my husband went for a little gin and egg white based one. i actually did not care for mine but his first and subsequent orders were both very good. 

one downside was that there was a band warming up in the corner while we were there. i'm sure their music is great but listening to the tune up was not ideal. 

i'd revisit maybe a little later at night once they get more into the swing of things.
author: Christina H.

description:
Another great addition by the Bourbon & Branch owners! Except that I prefer Devil's Acre to Bourbon branch for the following reasons: 

+ So much more space! Seriously, you can bring a date (make a reservation for one of those cute tables) or a group of friends (hang out downstairs in the smaller bar area or upstairs near the bar which has tons of standing room as well) and either way, you'll be pleased.
+ Amazing and large variety in drinks! The menu itself is long (but also really interesting, the art and design of it itself took a few minutes to take in) so be sure to try a bunch of different options if you're in a group and as always, the bartenders are extremely helpful in choosing drinks! The handcrafted cocktails get even cooler with the apothecary theme - watching your bartender make your drink is a treat in itself. 

And with both these benefits, you STILL get delicious drinks! I tried the Golden Era, which was an interesting gin based drink with applejack, plus rye, bitters etc. I loved the sweet & sour flavors and for $10, I thought it was a pretty good price for a bar by the same owners of B&B!  

Verdict: Worth a visit if you're in North Beach. Not as crazy crowded as B&B / other cool bars and you still get delicious drinks! 

Tips: 
+if it's too crowded upstairs, take your group downstairs where you'll find another room you can all mingle in (plus tables, so be on the lookout to snag one) 
+if you like gin, get the golden era! 
+definitely make a reservation if you want to sit with your date/friend because there are tons of small tables but only available by reservation
author: Anu P.

description:
I should probably visit again and write another review when I'm not pregnant. Because right now, if a bar has two pages of delicious non-alcoholic drinks and takes reservations so I am guaranteed a seat...one million stars!!!

But the drinks were great. I tried their take on a cream soda and root beer. Neither were syrupy or overly sweet, and both had a nice amount of herbal flavor. The rest of my group was more fun and tried some of their bourbon and gin based cocktails. We were most impressed with the Three Sworn Enemies (it had gold dust in it!) and Golden Era, which was an interesting mix of gin and applejack, along with some other ingredients. The Devil's Manhattan also got good reviews.

Service was friendly, though it did take awhile to get drinks on a Friday night. I recommend everyone ordering at once, as it takes a long time to make cocktails like these (a few of us finished a drink before the others have even ordered). And I do recommend making a reservation, as the walk-in area near the bar seemed to get very crowded and didn't look as comfortable.

All in all, great addition to the neighborhood!
author: Alison S.

description: Awesome! Beautiful interior, friendly amazing staff, great craft cocktails! Their menus were really retro and cool. I loved everything about this place. Sherry Cobbler was an experience to drink!!! And the Golden Era was reminiscent of an apple pie. Awesome. Awesome. Wish I lived in San Francisco just to be closer to this bar.
author: Erika S.

description: Terrible experience. We used the downstairs space for a private party and the rudeness of the manager on duty and lack of professionalism from the staff in general was appalling. The night started off by the manager rudely dismissing us when we arrived as he claimed we were early. After some discussion with my girlfriend, who had rented the place for her birthday, it was clear that there Devil's Acre had miscommunicated the arrival time. Instead of owning up to their mistake like anyone who knows the slightest thing about the hospitality and service business would do, the manager made the situation extremely uncomfortable by fetching the contract the terms and sticking it in my girlfriend's face claiming they had not agreed to open the doors until 9pm. Way to treat a paying guest that's bringing you four figure business on her birthday--bravo! The horrendous behavior of the service personnel did not stop there, unfortunately. The music they played sounded like some dystopian horror movie orchestra from the 60's that they didn't change until an hour into the party, the bar tender never informed the guests that a 20% gratuity was already included on the bar minimum--thereby greedily collecting extra tips from unknowing guests--and to top it all off, they sent everyone out and closed off the place more than an hour before pouring ends. Guests who were forced to end the party early ventured upstairs (if they hadn't left for home in disappointment) where Devil's Acre didn't let their business count against the bar minimum! Shame on you, Devil's Acre for ignoring customer service and running a scam operation.
author: Rune H.

description:
The drinks were  exactly what I expected after reviewing the menu, delicious!  Handcrafted cocktails that had so much flavor! Our waitress (I forgot her name) was very attentive and recommended some good drinks. 
I didn't know what to expect, so I made a reservation online which guaranteed us a table to sit at. At 4pm, the place wasn't really crowded, but as we were leaving around 5:30pm, the crowd starting rolling in.
Overall, we had a good time, drinks were yummy, and I would definitely visit again!
author: Marie V.

description:
Another new fancy cocktail spot from the same owners of Bourbon & Branch (my other fave).

Service was great and the drinks were delicious. I asked for a whisky-based, citrus-y, not-too-sweet drink and the bartender (Meatball?) made me a dealer's choice. The cocktail was yummy, well-balanced and strong, just the way I like 'em. I tried a few other drinks and they were just as amazing.

Seating is by reservation only, but there are stools and standing room near the bar and downstairs. The downstairs area was a little stuffy, but not too crowded for a Saturday night. The vibe was great and not too loud. Drinks took a little while to make, but def worth it. 

Will definitely be back.
author: Vivian H.

description:
I'm a fan! After wandering around Chintatown / North Beach area in search of a semi-calm semi-buzzing spot for a night cap, we finally landed on TDA. 

Space was nice, it's so refreshing to 1) not wait endlessly at the bar elbow to elbow/ college-style and 2) have a place to sit.

Drinks options were 'aplenty - fun cocktail list / booklet to flip through. Don't remember the names of ours, but they were all on point.
author: Brianna M.

description: Cool spot with interesting cocktails! Make a reservation in advance to get a table. If your a fan of craft cocktails definitely check this place out.
author: Sonya V.

description: Waitress was terrible but drink was great. Been a few times but not sure if I'll go again.
author: Douglas S.

description: I really wanted to love this place, but some cocktails fall flat despite having enticing descriptions (i.e. don't get the Manhattan with champagne).  Not that I had a bad experience, but I'm calling it a one-&-done/crossed off my list of places to try.  Although if I do return, the only cocktail that I'd order again is the Three Sworn Enemies.  Not only does it look fancy, it might be the best cocktail on their menu.
author: Riz W.

description: Delicious cocktails. We stopped in for a few drinks before a meal recently and were pleased. The theme is amusing. The drinks menu seemed to lean a bit to the sweet side, which is not my preference, but I was able to find things I enjoyed. The Three Sworn Enemies seems to be their most popular drink, and did not disappoint. 4 stars because I liked the drinks and the atmosphere, but not the best cocktails I've had around here, and it was quite loud despite being pretty empty.
author: Alison M.

description: Went for drinks with out of town friends. Loved the decor and the drink menu was great, I wanted to try so many which is rare. Service was great and loved our waitress. Can't wait to go back.
author: Ranee W.

description: There is no reason for the Thug bouncers who are rude....the waiters are polite and have a better vibe.  I would not go here again it is not a good extension of Bourbon & Branch / Local Edition.
author: J J.

description:
Fantastic addition to North Beach!

Last Sat we headed straight to the downstairs bar (feels like you're in a cozy romantic cave) and ordered 2 cocktails. I didn't like my initial cocktail, but before I could say anything, the mixologist made me a new drink and the second one was delicious. Just for his amazing attentiveness and service I give this place 5 stars, and we're sure to come back.

WARNING: if you text your friends you're hanging out here, they will automatically call you "so hip, and so trendy".
author: Angela B.

description: Interesting little bar downstairs from the main room. Selection of appropriate drinks to the period as well as full bar. We tried the Bijou and the Paramour, both Gin and citrus based I believe. The menu has some cool history printed under each drink or "elixir"... Only downside is terrible people go to this place. It's a VERY small ("intimate") room downstairs. Loud obnoxious how many times and how loudly can I talk about being wasted or make dick jokes in my shorts and flip flops kind of terrible people.
author: Michelle W.

description: Jamal, johnny and Bruce were the best 3 bartenders that I came across in San Francisco. I will return because of John you Jamal and Bruce. Awesome spot.
author: Robert S.

description: If you are in the mood for a delicious drink, please visit this bar! They have really interesting drinks, at reasonable prices ($9-12 for specialty cocktails). The atmosphere is neat- it reminds me of a speakeasy!
author: Holly C.

description: This place is awesome!  It is themed like the early 1900s and has great drinks that are reasonably priced (about $8).  It even offers homemade sodas like orange cream and root beer.
author: Jane H.

description: Great place great staff every single cocktail I tried was just amazing I can see my self spending the whole day here .
author: Vinicius O.

description: Angry bartenders who are not helpful navigating the detailed drink menu. First time here and I'm not coming back. Your loss.
author: Seonah I.

description: I have never had a cocktail with a pearl!  The drinks were delish & I loved the live jazz band. Very intimate bar wit lots of characters
author: Laura E.

description:
Stopped by for a cocktail last Sunday and found this to be an agreeable place.  The lay out was interesting, no seats at the bar, but lots of little tables - seems like a pretty good set up.  We grabbed a drink from the bar and then sat at a table.  There is also table service.  

Cocktails were all around $10.  I got a julep that was well crafted, but didn't love.  Service was good.  I'd consider trying this place again, maybe ask for something off the menu.
author: Marilyn C.

description:
Well made drinks, very cool spot. Devils Manhattan is the one to get.  The cream soda makes me want to have a child.

The Sherry Cobbler was . . . interesting.  It's definitely not what you'd expect - its not sweet at all, it's not too savory (not like a bloody mary), but it's kind of a mix in between.  Just be forewarned that it is . . . interesting.
author: Jason J.

description:
This is the first bar I am raving about.
Amazing amazing drinks.. I will be back for sure!
author: P D.

description: Had friends up visiting from Southern California and we had a Great night at the Devils Acre thanks to their manager David and staff. He got us a table even though they were late for our reservations coming into the city. We all had delicious craft cocktail drinks. Love their Devils Manhattan and how it comes with a brandied cherry and pearl accent! The whole place has a nice vibe true to the era. Very happy with the  newest place from the same masterminds that brought us Bourbon and Branch, and Tradition! They stayed true to good quality authentic drinks of the era, atmosphere, and offer good music down stairs for a more intimate feel in the Remedie. We are coming back again tonight Cheers!
author: katie r.

description:
It's great you're able to make reservations! Except the table next to us kept adding on so our small intimate group got pushed into a corner because these bros kept multiplying. lol. 

Vodka soda had zero taste of vodka, but it did the job so it was well crafted NOT watered down. Didn't get to go to the "secret bar." It was closed for a private party. 

No dancing, a little too loud to have conversation, but overall good experience.
author: Nicolette M.

description: Definitely not my "Type" of bar but we ended up having a ton of fun and the drinks were cool. Big bar with a larger top floor and smaller lower floor. Really busy considering that it was after 12 (I'm getting old here). My favorite part considering how late we were there was how much water the staff kept giving us! Thanks to this I felt great the next day :].
author: Stephanie D.

description: Ever wonder why alcohol is sometimes refered to as spirits? Its because back in the day people would soak a medicinal herb in alcohol to extract the spirit of the plant (the alkaloids) well this place is bringing that back with combination herbal tinctures you can ad to a variety of mixed drinks or home made sodas. I had a home made mezcal rootbeer with a couple of tinctures added.
author: Scott D.

description: Cool place with live jazz. The bartenders were seemingly nice fellows. It gets packed at night so go early!
author: Randi A.

description: Was here on Saturday and the vibe is great!  The drinks were strong and beautifully mixed- both tasted and looked great.  The service was a bit slow compared to how busy it was but otherwise no complaints!
author: Megan C.

description: Chad was incredible. I told him basic ingredients I enjoyed, and he made prob the best drink I've ever had. My newly engaged sister came in and also enjoyed a spectacular drink from Chad. He's great. Highly recommend for all your drinking drinks. Love, love.
author: Caitlin D.

description: Wow! Great craft cocktails! Deborah and Ryan were amazing.  I loved the music! And I especially loved the specially crafted cocktails!!!
author: Jannel G.

description:
probably my new favorite bar!

great cocktails and the bartenders are really nice!  Don't forget to check out the downstairs area!  There's another hidden bar below! It's a great date spot or a place to catch up with friends.
author: Tammy N.

description: I just had my birthday in their private room/bar, and it was AWESOME! Specifically because of Jay. Jay was our private bartender all evening and could not have been more amazing. He was lovely, energetic, attentive, engaging, and someone I would totally hang out with. Thank you Jay for making my birthday so special!
author: Marianne G.

description:
Had to make an update because the second go around wasn't as good as the first.  I arrived to meet friends after 10 pm last night and the place was jamming. I was hoping the reason to make reservations was to alleviate and avoid situations of having a stuffed bar.  Much like the vibe Bourbon and Branch has.  Unfortunately that wasn't the case and the place was popping at the seams (at least around the bars) There were an inordinate amount of impatient customers last night and the temperature of the venue didn't help that at all. The whole point of a speakeasy (at least I thought) was that it would be easy to speak but it was not. It was difficult to hold a conversation. After a round of fighting for drinks and trying to chat we gave up our table and left. 

I can't totally bash the place as it's still in it's infancy. The theme and the space is still one I adore. I just hope that in the upcoming weeks they can manage the reservation system to benefit the guests or do away with it and simply become a bar not trying to be a speakeasy. The positives were when you finally get to a bartender they are amazing to deal with and are charming and witty as hell. Sadly the population they allow through the doors hampers the whole experience. I plan to return in a couple months to see if the growing pains subside.
author: Joco F.

description: While in The City for work & we were in search for a good Old Fashioned. I ALWAYS make sure to take a trip to City Lights Bookstore, and The Devil's Acre was right across the street. AMAZING Old fashioned! The bartender was great! We also had the Three Sworn Enemies, also amazing! Will defnitely go back to try some other goodies!
author: Amy U.

description: Ye Gods this place is magical. Best drink menu I've seen.  Great staff. Avoid the downstairs as it is claustrophobic and loud. Worth every penny.
author: Troy B.

description: We met Randy the bar tender last night when we were out for my friends re-bachelorette party. We had never been to The Devil's Acre before but happened to walk by and it looked fun. SO glad we went in! Randy is amazing! He created fantastic drinks for us, celebrated my friend and helped us make the night memorable, and came up with a really fun and creative mini shot experience none of us had ever had. Ask him about it (it involves smelling jasmine essence before taking a root beer-ish shot). He totally made our night! This place is great if you're celebrating anything, check it out, and find Randy!
author: Susannah O.

description: Yumm... popped in here after a day of sightseeing for some late afternoon drinks. Their drinks were very unique and super tasty. My husband had a couple Devil's Manhattans, and I had a Call A Treuse and a Three Sworn Enemies.  Awesome drinks, great atmosphere, and good service. We wished we found out about this place earlier! If we were locals we would definitely come here regularly and try the different drinks.
author: Lauren S.

description:
I wanted to leave a bit of time between writing this review and the actual event to put it in perspective and to see if I would change my mind. 

A few weeks ago (30th of September to be exact) a few friends of mine celebrated a birthday at Devils Acre. The majority of the group came straight from the Houdini Escape room, pumped from the excitement of the task but also  absolutely sober, and arrived at the bar around 10:30ish. The place was pretty mellow and it took a little while to get the drinks situation sorted (multiple waiters, all wanting to have credit cards etc) but when the first drinks arrived they were amazing if a bit pricy. So far, so good. 
More friends came and went but the group never was bigger than maybe 15 people, chatting away on the far end of the room. At about 1am it became interesting, the waiter just came around for the last order of drinks and a few people went outside for a smoke, including the birthday boy. 
For whatever reason the bouncer decided not to let the party back in even though the jackets, wallets etc were insight. When we tried to communicate with the folks outside another bouncer came to our table to ask us to leave immediately even though they just brought the last round of drinks (it was about 1:10am at that time). When asking 'why' the bouncer got rather rude and tried to push people. 
We gathered our belongings and made our way out of the bar. One of our friends tried to reason with the bouncer and his colleague to at least let us finish the drinks (please picture, he was standing with is hand behind his back, non-threading and trying to have a conversation) but he didn't want to hear of it. 
I took my full glass and went to the bar to ask for a refund, which I actually received after some grumbling. While at the bar I overheard one of the barmaids (I assume the manager) on the phone to the police explaining that my friend who was having the conversation with the bouncer is violent and needs to be removed. I first thought I got this wrong but she described his appearance quite detailed. I cannot believe that behavior. I have never been treated like that and I don't think I will ever come back to that place. Granted the drinks are good, but everything else was just not working and the treatment at the end was the worst. I am sorry to have to out out such a bad review but if a place doesn't work I think people should know about it.
author: Alex D.

description: I rented out the Remedies Room for a birthday party and I was very happy with how accommodating everyone was..from the initial booking of to room Melissa was very prompt and informative and when I arrived our bartender (I believe his name was Jonathan) was really friendly and made some incredible drinks! The only reason this isn't 5 stars is because almost the whole night the room was really hot and I knew it was out of their control to change the AC unit but I had a lot of guest that were really uncomfortable because of the heat and the birthday was ready to pass out! Also when it was reaching the time to leave the bar tender was a little rude in rushing us out..overall I had a wonderful experience and I'd definitely recommend The Devil's Acre to any one who wants to have a good time. Also no wifi for an ipod I wanted to play music out of but the bartender was really nice and let me play music from his phone.
author: Tracey G.

description: If you're on Columbus, definitely stop by to get a drink and hear their wonderful cocktail singer. The menu is extensive and features old fashioned 'Elixrs' that you can add to any drink. The Prospector tastes like an old fashioned and featured gold glitter in the actual drink!
author: Katie P.

description: The cutest little bar in such a wonderful part of SF! The staff is super friendly and yummy drinks!
author: Tiffany M.

description: I walked in here on a whim thinking that it was a bar that I saw on a TV show (Best Bars in America).  Turns out the place was not on the show, but it should have been because the place was amazing.  The mixologist don't give a f*** about anything other than your cocktail.  And if you push hard enough you might even get them to battle over "who makes the best Old Fashion".  But watch out... you may end up with a splash of mezcal in your Old Fashion.  Those that know me, know that... I drink... a lot.  This is the best bar I have ever been to.  That is the best thing I can say about any bar.  A must when in San Francisco.
author: Raulito P.

description: One of my favorite places in the city to enjoy a beautifully handcrafted cocktail. The mixers are refreshing and is perfectly paired with alcohol. The ambiance is very dim, but I love it.
author: Marie G.

description: Great old school, Prohibition-era cocktail bar/speakeasy from the Bourbon & Branch folks (also do Wilson & Wilson, Swig, Local Edition, Cask, and the Rickhouse) - happening spot indeed with some of the best cocktails in the city. Walking through the door feels like a portal to the 1920s where everyone is smiling.
author: Robert B.

description: What a fun place to stop in for a drink or two! We got there on the early side, I think later would have been more ideal in terms of ambiance. Even so, there was live jazz, and the service was very nice and helpful. The main conceit of the menu is a kind of old time medicine store, and as a result the drinks are equal parts whimsical and balanced. If you like complex, herbally-oriented drinks, this is the place for you!
author: Brian O.

description: I tried their Pisco punch and loved it. This place has great ambience. Will definitely visit again.
author: Namrata H.

description: Sad. We were so excited for some interesting cocktails and a cool atmosphere and they failed on both. Queen wasn't exactly what we were hoping for in this period inspired bar. The design of the interior is great but the cocktails missed the bar. The pianist saved the night.
author: Kassi M.

description: Great place for some classic drinks and trying lots of unheard of ones off their neat menu!!
author: megan e.

description:
drinks are good.
cool concept.
live jazz on sundays.
make reservations or stand at bar (or locate a table w/o a *reserved* sign).

need more staff - we were there sunday night and it was fairly packed with ONE waitress that was also doubling as the hostess.  and only two bartenders.  it took 15-20 minutes to receive our first set of drinks.  then another 10 minutes to get one glass of water (there were two of us).  no cloth coasters this time... actually no coasters what so ever this time.  looked around and some people had cardboard coasters and others none...

4 star rating was based on the first visit. had i based it on the most recent one, it would've been 2 for service but + 1 for the live jazz.  will try again and hope the poor service was a poor planning anomaly by management or someone called in *sick*
author: Tina F.

description: This place rocks!  Wow!  Amazing cocktails.  Went last night fairly early so the crowd hadn't arrived.  Had the Bourbon Crusta which was amazing and my wife had a Mezcal drink which she loved.  Speaking of Mezcal, Eric (the bartender who looks Irish but isn't) is your go to guy for Mezcal. He is a super dude. Has his own company in Oaxaca called Puro Burro.  Over two cocktails, in which he poured us tastings of at least 4 different Mezcals, he taught us a ton about the Agave plant (not the Agave cactus=Tequilla). The other bartenders are super chill and all very knowledgeable. They just got their music license and plan to have live music in the near future.   If you are into cocktails, you owe it to yourself to go there.   Go early to avoid the crowds.
author: Michael B.

description: Awesome stuff here! Walked in and they were playing the Kinks. Instantly hooked! Cocktails are great here. Nice selection of spirit-forward cocktails. Fantastic music. It's also right near City Lights Bookstore. Stumble in and read some Kerouac why not.
author: Jonathan D.

description: I REALLY wanted to like this place because I heard good things and the reviews were good. The bartender on March 20th 2015 was really rude. I just walked inside of the bar and didn't even say a word and he refused to serve me..ok can you give me a chance to even speak before making an assumption like that? Whatever so I didn't get to try the drinks and now I am back in Chicago and will never know how good they are....
author: Alessandra A.

description: Great prohibition era bar with big windows looking out onto the lights of Columbus Street, or opt to  take a cozier spot downstairs and really get the full speakeasy feel.  Herbaceous & unique concoctions at a reasonable price with friendly and knowledgable staff that will take you through the menu.  Volume inside at 7:30 on a Wednesday eve was low, so it was a great place to have a nice conversation. Not a huge fan of the table set-up (except with booths) but it does provide ample space. Make a reservation to guarantee yourself a good spot!
author: Angie H.

description: The bar has nice decor and a fun menu, but the staff had some trouble with some classic cocktails. They did make it right with some shots and were nice. The bathroom was messy. Nothing bad, but the place wants to be a fun olde timey cocktail bar. It would be at 5/5 if not for those things.
author: G S.

description: Excellent cocktails here! These bartenders KNOW what they are doing, which is rare. This place usually gets pretty loud so dont expect to have a quiet intimate conversation.
author: N S.

description: Nice place with tasty cocktails and a swanky ambiance.  We really enjoyed our drinks, and the service was pretty good too, though a bit slow (typical for upscale cocktail bars).  My only criticism is the fact that they don't have any food (yet?), so you can only go early before dinner or late after dinner.  To hit the happy hour crowd, they'd do well to at least serve some light munchies for people to get their drink on without having to leave early to eat something.  Overall, a fun place!  I'll be back.
author: Erin B.

description: Service great, atmosphere fun and cocktails tasty without being precious.
author: Kim B.

description: Most knowledgable staff I have ever met at a bar.  Incredible history of SF they shared with us as well as the delicious Pisco Punch.
author: Ryan M.

description: Stumbled upon this gem while in town for a one night only work trip. Great live jazz and creative cocktails. Great atmosphere to sit alone with a drink and listen to music!
author: Heidi S.

description: WOW! This bar is awesome. Stumble upon it by accident, just walking around San Francisco. The place has a cool vibe, you could either sit at the tables or stand by the bar. We stood at the bar. The bartender was very friendly and helpful. They have a very extensive menu. My husband tried the Yamazaki Single Malt which he had been dying to try since we can't find it where we leave by. I told the bartender I don't like drinks i am more of a dirty martini kind of gal, so he prepared the best dirty martini i've had by far. The prices were normal but worth the experience.
author: Lili M.

description: One month old and this places feels like a well oiled machine. Perfected cocktails, well knowledge cocktail concierges, and thoughtful decor. Our cocktail server, Sarah, was super helpful with describing the almanac menu and the background of the bar. She was well versed in all the drinks and elixir mixes. Our party of four first round were the following drinks: Fancy Brandy Cocktail, Bourbon Crusta, Devil's Manhattan, and Lauchlan's Antisorbutic. Second round we all ordered the Devil's Manhattan. This bar doesn't serve food so fill up on drinks then head to little Italy for some pizza!
author: Joy L.

description: Excellent drinks and awesome atmosphere.  The basement isn't really a "secret" speakeasy like other Bourbon and Branch places, but has wonder ambiance.  Staff were all very friendly and knowledgeable.
author: John C.

description: Fantastic menu, great service and really spot-on cocktails. It's a pretty big space that's really well-appointed with just the kind of decor you'd expect in the Barbary Coast. Highly recommend it for a good night out.
author: Catie M.

description: Make this your first stop before heading all the way into North Beach in order to appreciate all the wild concoctions.  The first time we stopped by on our way out of town after a long day drinking bar hopping adventure and it just wasn't the same as when I could examine the wide variety of drinks and learn about them from the knowledgeable staff.  We each ordered a different drink and sampled them all.  Surprisingly I liked three of the four and only didn't like the fourth because I'm not a fan of bourbon but it was beautiful and sparkly (Three Sworn Enemies: Cyrus noble bourbon, grand poppy, vanilla syrup, angostura and orange bitters, gold dust).  I don't like a sweet drink which is why I ordered Lauchlans Antiscorbutic which was a mix of three gins and lime but the Pisco Punch was also tasty and it wasn't too sweet.  The strangest one was Dr. Crawfords Pick Me Up which had caffeine, rootbeer flavor and a spritz of smelling salts.  I'm ordering this next time if I need a bump.  Three of us had a second round (Golden Era, Paramour and Bijou) I think the Bijou was my least favorite but I'll need to try the other two again to compare cause I don't quite remember beyond that.
author: Dianne M.

description: The drinks are amazing. Three sworn enemies was delicious and strong. I also tried the non-alcholic drinks and it's decent if you need to take a breather. The service was amazing on a Saturday night at 9:30pm+.
author: S T.

description: New favorite bar in SF. Great menu, creative drinks, good selection. Not crowded, you can actually sit and chill out. We had the yamazaki 12 year, golden era, and cream soda (non alc). All were made well. The best part was their music, 2000s r&b and hip hop. Will be back!!
author: Carissa C.

description:
If I keep writing reviews like this, I'll probably get sent to live in Sacramento.

But really?

My friends told me this was the hottest new San Francisco establishment. (They also said the same about Tosca-- apparently they've never seen the historic musical.)

Something tells me you don't need two door guys and extra security (though they were all charming and may have been the best part of the place) to guard your new joint. Are you protecting your patrons against whoever walks out of the Garden of Eden at 10 pm?

The already dull ambiance was crushed by the homogenized hotel upholstery and the cheap wallpaper. 

The main level is full of tables of three discussing in hushed tones how bad-ass it would be to spend the rest of the night building a throw-back slot machine in Visual Basic.

The steamy basement could be cool, if it was steamy for a good reason. Instead of a scene from Dirty Dancing 3, the lower level was filled with awkwardly tall girls (you know I envy you-- but you gotta own it) standing around in those ill-fitting cream silk tanks from J Crew and the most blasé 'statement' necklaces you can imagine.

I give this place 10 months.
author: kalla v.

description: Great, unique drinks at a decent price. There's also ample seating. It does get a bit crowded though. The pharmacy theme is great.
author: Tim L.

description: I rented out the room downstairs for my birthday and it was a great venue! The staff was super nice, Jay our bartender was excellent and everyone had a great time. The space was a good size too! I highly recommend this place!
author: Lauren W.

description: A uniquely pretensious bar with drinks to rival their attitude towards patrons. If you are looking for an excuse to ruin your day with terrible service and contentious employees then absolutely spend your money in this establishment. There are equally satisfying drinks at any other establishment in North Beach.
author: Ben T.

description: Good cocktails, nice staff, seedy neighborhood.
author: James R.

description: Had a great experience at Devil's Acre. The bartender was amazing and we even got a tour of the bar downstairs-would be a great spot for a private party.
author: Trista S.

description: I had high expectations for this place based on some reviews and my fondness for "speakeasy" type bars.  This was NOT a speakeasy experience.  At 6p, the place was already so crowded, I had to yell at my date so she could hear me.  MAJOR turn-off!  The one cocktail we had, before we ran out of the place, was good. If you're 21-25, like most of the customers were, you might not mind the noise.  But if you're older than 30, looking for a nice place with a unique environment, friendly service, the ability to hold a conversation, and the like, go elsewhere. This place was not intimate, not romantic, not trendy, not unique, and not classy. Final thought: how does a bar not have seats at the bar?  Strange, disappointing place.
author: Scott M.

description: place has a large bar with no stools or seats. Your options are stand at the bar or you have to sit and get a table. My wife and I show up at 5:30pm on a Wednesday and go to the bar to get a drink(a martini and a virgin cocktail) before our dinner next door at Toscas. My wife is 8 months pregnant and they wouldn't allow her to use one of the unused chairs which was in the corner to sit at the bar. I could tell the waitress(woman) felt bad, but the manager(male) clearly did not. There was not one other person at the bar and she was forced to stand. So that coupled with the large open doors to Columbus Avenue with lovely whaffs of smoke from people outside and all of the tourists walking by......don't think we will be back
author: Jeffrey S.

description: The drinks were strong and worth the price (for San Francisco). I really enjoyed the atmosphere. It is a super cute venue, perfect for a relaxed evening drink with friends. It also wasn't too loud to have actual conversations, which was awesome! Can't wait to come again.
author: Evanne L.

description: It takes awhile to get a drink, but they're perfectly made. One time my friend ordered a drink she did not like at all, and they made her a new one. This doesn't happen frequently, and the response goes a LONG way in my book.
author: Heather M.

description: I give five stars to the fantastic bartenders here however the security staff was beyond aggressive and ready to fight. Super great night that ended awful due to a security guard who was ready to throw punches. Left this place after spending a nice amount of money feeling sickened by one staff member. I will never return here and you can find much better places in the city to spend your money. The security guard with his ear piece told me he hates humans and dealing with them. Then he told me he was an alien. I kid you not. Such a lame night slash super weird. Anyways go anywhere but here!
author: Camille B.

description: Great vibe and the menu to match. Ordered a Three Sworn Enemies and it was one of the best drinks I've had all month. Is strongly recommend this bar to anyone who likes drinks and has any semblance of class.
author: Brian P.

description:
Amazing space, great drinks, friendly bartenders and maître d' - a very nice addition to north beach. 

However, none of that matters because the acoustics suck. I have yet to find a really fun bar in SF that has correctly managed their sound. No sign of ceiling baffles or sound panels or sound absorbing drapery or anything. I had to yell the entire time I was there and the bar wasn't even full. I lost my voice, didn't get it back until late the next day.

I wish bars here would realize that you can have amazing energy and ambiance without insane noise - they do it beautifully in NYC why not here? I'm baffled.
author: Patricia H.

description: Great drinks, music, and knowledgeable staff.   Would definitely come here again. The bartender turned an ordinary request for bourbon into a 10 minute personal crafting session.  We will certainly not ask for bourbon the same way again.
author: Mike P.

description: Opened recently, this is a good before dinner drink place. We had the juliep, Manhattan and the non alcoholic root beer soda fountain drink. All delicious and reasonably priced.
author: Chrissie W.

description: Awesome drinks, awesome vibes. What a great place to grab a quick drink with friends.
author: Kari L.

description: Bad idea coming here. Came here for the first time for a night out with my friend after a conference. We got there at 11:20 PM and was greeted at the door by the bouncer who told us that they close at 12 and last call was just being called. We went to the bar and looked over the menu. We ordered two drinks at $23.00 and was given our bill since they were closing. 10 mins later no drinks but got a 10 min warning from the referee (aka bouncer). 5 mins later we eventually got our drinks. We asked the bartender if we had time to drink our drinks or if we had to chug them. She hesitated but said yes. Not 5 mins later the referee came to tell us that we had to leave. We told him that we just got our drinks but told us "thanks for coming" and proceeded to hover over us like a fat kid on a cupcake until we finished our drinks and left. Felt like a college kid at a dive bar rather than a working professional at a cocktail bar. Bartender shouldn't take orders if there closing and bar shouldn't say they close at 12 if it's really 11:45. That's about all I have to say about that.
author: Ian L.

description: Delightful cocktails although an abysmal wait staff. Literally kicked out the moment the bar closed with drinks remaining. Would not recommend.
author: Jason B.

description: Expensive but that should be expected for the type of place that it is. Disappointing that a draft 12oz (10oz served) cost so much. Typical craft drinks range 10-15 dollars. Drinks downstairs took quite awhile and it was really annoying having to leave the table and conversation just to go order a drink at the bar. They need a waitstaff downstairs.
author: Burt D.

description: Cocktails were okay. We were seated in the middle of the bar with lots of tables available in the corner which I generally prefer. Serving was good and on time.
author: Julia K.

description: busy thurs night, good cocktails (devils manhattan) - remedy room
author: Jerome Y.

description: Great place to grab a drink and right on the Barbary Coast of San Francisco.  Really cool speakeasy feel which has a bar and a sitting area.  Not to mention the music is fantastically themed! Darren helped me find the perfect drink on my first visit.  Love to see new places on Columbus.  This place is going to become a fixture! Definitely will be returning.
author: Just N.

description: Went here last night on way home from work - opened last night...have been waiting for this place to open.  It's amazing - great speak easy style bar, amazing drinks and they did a great job converting the past bar (Jazz at Pearls) into The Devil's Acre.  The bartenders are super knowledgable about the Barbary Coast and the area's history...oh ya, and did I mention they make AMAZING drinks!?!
author: Tom F.

description: Oh man. Where to begin. Drinks are amazing! Three Sworn Enemies is my favorite and the Mint Julep is pretty good too. Be warned, these drinks are as delicious as they are strong!
author: Kate S.

description: These guys know what they're doing! I recommend a bourbon crusta! The only reason it's not 5 stars is because the drinks are so involved they take a bit too make and on a weekend I'm sure you'll wait a while.
author: Allen B.

description: Just had one of the worst experiences here. I walked in with two other friends, the bouncer wasn't at the door so we walked up to the bar and asked for a table. The server is great and starts to take us to the table when the bouncer then runs over and says we are kicked out. It turns out he wasn't at his post when we walked in, and he's nervously trying to fix the situation by kicking us out. Simply asking for our IDs would have been fine. I politely asked for his name and he told me his name was Johnny Appleseed....i understand you made a mistake, but it super easy to fix, just check out ids and let us have the table. At this point he says "if you don't leave I will make you leave'. Feeling physically threatened we went to the door where I asked for the managers name or number, which he refused to give me. All I wanted was to be able to follow up on why I was kicked out of a bar with 3 friends who are meeting for a going away celebration. Not sure who the doorman with the powertrip is. Wears a fake diamond necklace, and 3 piece suit, keep an eye out this guy is a real jerk. Don't waste your time here this bar is trash. Could have been a great time but this bouncer had to ruin it after he was caught sleeping on the job. Message to management: get new door staff.
author: Brandon G.

description: had my first night here finally. it was a fantastic time! great cocktails, superior service, great atmosphere/ decor. I'm adding this bar to my bar hop round for my drinking buddies.
author: Iliea S.

description: What a great place. Tremendous variety of cocktails, affordable prices, and thematic (late 19th century?) decor. While I was here they had a live jazz band. Snazzy! Had a call a treuse, chartreuse based drink with egg white. Lots of complexity--herby and spicy! Three sworn enemies is also pretty good, a variant of an old fashioned. Many drinks here have some type of syrup, perhaps bar-meets-old-timey-pharmacy idea.
author: Chen C.

description: Great services and drinks! I love mint juleps and they are great here. The services was wonderful and I would definitely recommend
author: Caitlin V.

description: Walked in, walked out. Depressing vibe. Piercingly loud and it wasn't even full. Didn't even have a drink so can't review that. Special event going on downstairs so didn't see it. Sorry.
author: L L.

description: Absolutely loved every aspect of this place, minus the hostess- hence the one star off. If we weren't greeted with a smug attitude and treated like we were an annoyance rather than eager customers, it would have been a flawless experience. The atmosphere was great- decor, music, etcetera. Cocktails=delicious and reasonable for craft drinks. Call a treuse was my fav and we could not get over the golden dust in Three Sworn Enemies (plus the back story on the ice from our server). Speaking of, our server, Kristin, was an absolute doll!! Such a pleasant, genuine, sweet girl with helpful recommendations. Will def be back for round 2 soon.
author: Kristen C.

description: Good drinks, but the ambiance was a bit too "restaurant-like."  There are no stools at the bar, and the table setup implies food should be served.  Perhaps this works when it is more crowded, but I would think booths and lounge seating would work a lot better.
author: Razor S.

description: We found this bar based on Yelp reviews and were happy we did.  Quite an experience.  The bartenders are true mixologists.  Wearing lab style aprons, expertly applying a handful of jiggers with stirring and muddling devices like a practiced scientist, the bartenders concocted amazing and unique drinks.  Ordering a grey hound and a tequila lemon drop, the bartender asked if he could have fun with our drinks.  "Sure, go for it."  With a flurry, he added mysterious powders and potions from curious brown jars and bottles.  Measuring, pouring, blending and tasting with  precise care, I was eager to taste what he was so proud to prepare.  The drinks were familiar yet unique in their flavors.  They were potent as well.  The scene was energetic with music and dark lighting.  It took time in line to get a drink, but this was not your normal bar service either.  A great end to our day and our trip to SFO.
author: Todd R.
